question_content.barrons:question: The author’s attitude toward the school of historical writing he discusses can best be described as one of
question_content.barrons:explanation:
open disdain.

The author’s highly negative analysis of the article in Américas suggests that his attitude toward the school of historical writing it exemplifies is one of open disdain or scorn.

Grudging approbation in incorrect. The author shows no approbation (approval) whatsoever of the school of historical writing under discussion.

Puzzled fascination is incorrect. The author is neither fascinated nor puzzled by the school of historical writing under discussion; he understands its flaws and criticizes its effectiveness.

Relentless enmity is incorrect. While the author is critical of the school of historical writing under discussion, his negative attitude toward it is not strong enough to be classified as relentless enmity (hatred).

Measured admiration is incorrect. The author shows no admiration (respect; esteem) whatsoever for the school of historical writing under discussion.
